meanings.sent1: The glop of paint dripped onto the floor.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally stepped in the glop of spilled syrup.
meanings.sent3: The chef's attempt at a fancy dessert turned into a glop of melted ice cream.
meanings.sent4: The mud on the trail looked like a glop of chocolate pudding.
meanings.sent5: The child's hands were covered in sticky glop after playing with slime.

meanings.definition: To eat or drink quickly and greedily.
meanings.sent1: He glopped down his soup before anyone else could get a taste.
meanings.sent2: The hungry dog glopped up his food in seconds.
meanings.sent3: She glopped down her smoothie in one big gulp.
meanings.sent4: The raccoon glopped up the leftovers from the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The kids glopped down the candy at the party.
